revised_title: The Role of Bcl-2 in Lymphoid Cell Development and Malignancy
tldr: The article discusses the role of the bcl-2 gene in the development and function of lymphocytes and their malignant transformation. Expression of a bcl-2 transgene in B lymphoid cells disrupted homeostasis and led to autoimmune diseases, while T lymphoid cells showed resistance to cytotoxic agents. The bcl-2 gene promotes cell survival and has implications for understanding lymphomagenesis.
